{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3131473,"name":"Miles","username":"trompmil24","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/48db29/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T21:04:30.912Z","cooked":"

Hello, I am trying to use PathPlanner to make a simple auto path for our robot but I am having some trouble. I tried using the PPSwerveControllerCommand but when I enable the robot in autonomous, it does not move. I know that it is trying to follow the right path because it runs for the correct amount of time that it says the path will take. Also in Shuffleboard, I have a widget for X position error and when I enable it, the error increases to the length of the path. (The path is just a strait line). We also have everything updated per WPIlib’s latest update (2023.2.1). I used the code from SDS for the swerve mods, it drives good in tele-op. Any help would be appreciated.

Here is the code. I made the PPSwerveControllerCommand in robot container. I also tried using a swerve auto builder but had similar results. (Sorry the code is kinda messy).

Do you know what the “state” swerve module state consumer does?

Or what the “position” pose 2d supplier does?

“State” is what the controller pushes its outputs too. You it set to a blank consumer. The controller is working its just screaming into the void. It should be something like

DrivetrainSubsystem::drive
Where drive is a method that makes the robot move and has a SwerveModuleState[] argument

Likewise the “position” supplier is what the controller uses for feedback, to figure out how far off your robot is from its target. It is also referencing an empty object and should be something like

DrivetrainSubsystem::getPose

Where getPose is a method that returns the robots current pose.

Also this is an aside but you set your robots max velocity to 10 meters per second… may want to turn that down (assuming you’re using SI units disregard if this is feet/s)

Finally I would heavily recomend reading both the pathplanner lib documentation and WPI’s SwerveControllerCommand documentation and example code because the pathplanner command is incredibly similar.

I wasn’t exactly sure how Consumers and Suppliers work, I just saw they were needed to make a PPSwerveControllerCommand. How would I go about setting them up correctly? I tried putting a drive function into the swerve states consumer but I think it’s still “screaming into the void”.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-21T23:03:43.752Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":41.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":424244,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-autonomous-trouble","display_username":"Miles","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":38127,"username":"tylerhedge","name":"tyler hedge","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/b5e925/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56623,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-autonomous-trouble/424244/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3131564,"name":"tyler hedge","username":"tylerhedge","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/b5e925/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T23:13:31.169Z","cooked":"

To my understanding consumers/suppliers are interfaces that well consume and supply. The easy way to do them is in the auto builder constructer reference the method that you want to be a consumer/supplier like so:

Class::method

Ok, thanks for your help. I understand better now. When trying to create a SwerveDriveOdometry Object, I am having trouble with the array of the Swerve Module Positions, I am not able to do the getPosition() function for any modules. Here is the code in the docs:

SwerveDriveOdometry m_odometry = new SwerveDriveOdometry(
m_kinematics, m_gyro.getRotation2d(),
new SwerveModulePosition[] {
m_frontLeftModule.getPosition(), <–not able to do any of these getPositions
m_frontRightModule.getPosition(),
m_backLeftModule.getPosition(),
m_backRightModule.getPosition()
}, new Pose2d(5.0, 13.5, new Rotation2d()));

My team encountered this aswell assuming your using SDS’s swerve code its really difficult to get encoder positions. Its not perfect, but what we did was just compute the tick count ourselves using the velocity.

This method belongs in the periodic section of your swerve module code. Following is a mix of actual and pseudo code:

public SwerveModulePosition getPosition() {
return new SwerveModulePosition(driveEncoderReadingInTicks * Math.PI * wheelDiameter / (DriveGearRatio * encoderResolution), new Rotation2d(steeringEncoderReadingInDegrees * Math.PI / 180));
}

1.3.0","slug":"psa-update-your-radios-firmware-to-1-3-0","posts_count":10,"reply_count":8,"highest_post_number":10,"image_url":null,"created_at":"2025-02-25T12:36:44.280Z","last_posted_at":"2025-02-26T04:04:27.552Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2025-02-26T04:04:27.552Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"Team Update 13 requires Radio Firmware 1.3.0, which was released on 2/14.
